EDITORS COMMENTS

This print captures the tragic moment of the "Mort du Prince Jozef Poniatowski" during the Battle of Leipzig. Painted by renowned artist Horace Vernet in 1820, this colour lithograph showcases his exceptional talent for capturing emotion and historical events. In this scene, we witness the intense chaos and devastation of war as Prince Jozef Poniatowski meets his untimely demise. Clad in a military uniform, he bravely leads his army on horseback through a river, desperately trying to escape from the clutches of death. The powerful image conveys both the heroism and vulnerability of soldiers caught in the midst of conflict. As we gaze upon this artwork, we are transported back to a tumultuous era - the Napoleonic Wars that ravaged Europe between 1804 and 1815. It serves as a poignant reminder of Poland's struggle for independence during this time. Vernet's meticulous attention to detail brings every element to life - from the intricate depiction of Poniatowski's noble steed to the swirling currents that surround them. This print is not just an artistic masterpiece but also an important historical document that immortalizes one man's sacrifice for his country. Displayed proudly in private collections around the world, this piece continues to captivate viewers with its profound narrative and exquisite craftsmanship. It stands as a testament to Vernet's skill as an artist and serves as a somber tribute to those who have fallen in battle throughout history.
